TopicTitle: Streaming on Twitch with a mac

Articles.Content:
Hi!

Recently, I tried to stream on Twitch, from a macbook pro. However, if the screen was correctly streamed, the audio wasn't streamed at all(i.e: you could see what was happening on my screen, but you couldn't hear anything from the game's sound).

In the software I use for streaming(*)(or, tried to) it say that I need another software called "wavtap". However, to install it properly, I would need to instal a kernel extension and play with the terminal, which seem a bit risky for me since I have no experience at all with the terminal.

Is there any other way or software to capture the sound from a game and stream it with Twitch? The only software on mac that doesn't need other software to work cost nearly 500$ which is a bit costly(but just a bit )

EDIT:

(*) I used Open Broadcaster Software

Edited September 28, 2015 by goldenpeach

Very good recording/streaming software is this, Open Broadcaster Software. I have no trouble using it, you find yor stream key, personalize some settings, and click 'Start Streaming' and you are good to go!

And both need some playing with the terminal and kernel extension.
Try using FFSplit, i'm not sure if that'll help. it's what i use though.
